intro: Carpolyza, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors. The leaves are typically thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Carpolyza species are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their beauty and ability to thrive in indoor settings. They prefer well-drained soil and indirect sunlight to flourish.
